15 is the latest approved patch-set.
No files were changed between the latest approved patch-set and the submitted one.
Hi Thu, I've suggested some improvements that should help with the clarity of the implementation.

Thanks for updating the changelog :) However, the intent is that it's to track changes to the public API/ABI. This way it's easy for users of the library to understand how they're impacted by upgrading. The `msgbuf` APIs are purely internal to the library implementation, users have no visibility of them, hence I'd prefer to not add `msgbuf`-related changes here.
Done
[strnlen(3)](https://www.man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/strnlen.3.html)?
Done
We already discovered the length above, so I don't think we need to use `strlen()` again here.
Done
Hi Thu, I have a few concerns. Probably the main one is not adding more calls to `pldm_msgbuf_init_cc()` 😄
Ah, do you mind putting this after the variable declaration below?
Done
I think `EOVERFLOW` is probably better here.
Done
If we do `length++;` here we can avoid doing the same addition twice below.
Done
The cast shouldn't be necessary?
Done

Please let's not add more use of `pldm_msgbuf_init_cc()` in the codebase.

Please audit the rest of the tests for this concern.
Done
Why do we need to insert the data from `src` into `buf`? Why not use `src` directly below on line 845?
Done
Ah, so it doesn't do this directly, it just provides the pointer to the string in the buffer (... and I've added a suggestion for the length as well). Can you please rephrase this?
Done
Hi Thu, I think there are just a couple more cleanups and this should be good to go. Thanks for the improvements so far.

Can we add a `size_t *length` argument just for completeness?

If we allow it to be `NULL` then callers don't have to bother with providing an object pointer if they don't care.

Done. Do you want to apply this change to next patch `
msgbuf: Add pldm_msgbuf_span_string_utf16()`?
I saw your comment in that patch set. I will update it later.
Might have to rename this given the `length` argument suggestion, maybe `measured`?
Done
Done
Done

Unfortunately this creates a VLA ("variable length array"), as `const` variables cannot be used as an "integer constant expression". See:

https://thephd.dev/constant-integers-are-actually-constant-wow-finally-someones-writing-the-goddamn-paper-%F0%9F%99%84

If you declare `required` as `constexpr` that should help.
Done
Please use `pldm_msgbuf_init_errno()` throughout. I don't want to see  more calls to `pldm_msgbuf_init_cc()` added to the codebase.
Done
`strncmp()`?
Done
Can you please add an underflow test as well? For example, like `span_required_under` below:
Done
The tests you've added should be after this one.
Done
Hi Thu, this broadly looks good. I only have a couple of comments on the tests

`PLDM_SUCCESS` is a PLDM completion code, but you're using `pldm_msgbuf_init_errno()`. Please compare against `0` (and regular negative `errno` values) instead (I realise `PLDM_SUCCESS` is defined as `0`, but the point is that using the completion code symbol is confusing in this context)

This should be fixed throughout your tests below.
Done
This can be `EXPECT_EQ(required, length);`?
Done
Thanks!
Done
Nice!
Do we want to add this entry in CHNAGELOG.md file?
I'd like to keep the changelog useful to users of the library, rather than implementers. As the `msgbuf` APIs are internal to the library implementation I prefer we avoid adding a changelog entry.
We should update the commit message reflect the changing of API when allow NULL cursor.
Done
Please put empty lines on either side of the code-block, just for readability 😊
Done
Hi Thu, just one small request on the commit message.
